title: A big fan of this app however it messed with my dates
content:
Iâ€™m a big fan of this app! Iâ€™ve used it for my dog-sitting career for almost 2 years now. I like the way it looks compared to the apple calendar app which is NOT friendly for my dog-sitting needs as I need to see whole months in retrospect and not just a little bubble underneath individual dates

Unfortunately this week it moved a lot of my dog-sitting trips to wrong days and times. I donâ€™t know what happened but thank god I had a lot of my trips memorized, but because of the Calendar being buggy, i messed up on one of my dog-sitting trips because the calendar had moved it to the next day. Some dates had been moved to different hours, some different days. At first I thought I had written the dates wrong but it happened with so many of them I knew it wasn't a coincidence. Iâ€™ve been using this app for years and Iâ€™ve never had this problem. However this makes me a little bit more wary using Minical moving forward, make sure you have another calendar possibly or a way of making sure your dates arenâ€™t going to glitch out. 

also some quality of life features that would be nice
- an option to keep the past months from the calendar when the months are over. I hate that I canâ€™t have my whole year saved in the calendar and it deletes past months. Makeâ€™s doing things like my taxes harder because I canâ€™t keep track of how much I worked certain months. 
- the way the 1st of the month starts can be glitchy. Sometimes it doesnâ€™t show up on the month, the month starts on the 2nd, and in order to see the 1st you need to go back a month. 
- Iâ€™ve found when a month is full the app can behave a little glitchy. Thatâ€™s whats happening to me currently and I implore someone to take a look at it.

title: Nice Lock Screen widgets

I like the two week calendar view on the Lock Screen, it is very minimalist as the name implies, and shows a line under days with events. Adding events, editing, templates and url preview within events is nice and streamlined. Duplicating events across days is also useful. A good calendar app that works well alongside more full-featured calendar apps while providing a lot with the widget options. 

Pro version removes ads for one time purchase, and is worth it because the ads can be very intrusive.

title: Perfect Calendar!
content:
I was using the Readdle Calendar app for years until they recently switched to subscription.

Iâ€™m glad they did because then I started looking for a new calendar app and this one is SO MUCH BETTER - and reasonably priced to boot. Thank you to the developers!

The interface is as it describes - minimal. The feature that shows daily events below the calendar is seamless and itâ€™s not a feature Iâ€™ve had in any other calendar app. I really enjoy it! 

If you decide on the free version the ad banner is not at all obtrusive so you can really get a feel for the app before committing to purchase.

Visuals and tidy appearance are very important in my book, and this app nails it 10/10. 

Thanks for helping me stay organized!

title: Loved it until everything disappeared
content:
Iâ€™ve used Minical for 3+ years and trusted it to store all my important info â€” including trips, personal information, life events. I never used Gmail or iCloud calendars with it; I just used the app itself. But recently I tried syncing my Gmail to use Minical across devices (like my iPad), and after removing and re-adding the Gmail account, everything disappeared. None of my data was saved to Gmail or iCloud, so thereâ€™s nowhere for it to pull from.

I never deleted the app, and it still shows 155MB of documents/data in my iPhone storage, so I know the data must still be on my phone somewhere. 

Please help me recover it â€” this app meant a lot to me, and this has been really distressing. I canâ€™t find a direct support email anywhere. Iâ€™m begging someone from the team to respond. I need to recover this data. Please contact me or tell me how I can reach you.

title: Clean, beautiful, functional, minimalist
content:

I have two wishes that would make it perfect in my mind:

1. I wish that if you were to swipe left or right on the schedule part it would advance by one day in the appropriately direction. Right now, it is somewhat jarring that when youâ€™re looking at a schedule for a Tuesday in the middle of the February and you swipe to go to the next day, you end up on March 1.

2. I wish there were some way, even if it were just a brief view, to be able to see a day schedule that shows open spaces. Sometimes itâ€™s just difficult to know where you have openings when youâ€™re only looking at it in a scheduled view. To have this option would mean I wouldnâ€™t need any other calendar at all.

title: Something has happened
content:
I wish to thank the developer so very much for fixing the location address issue. I am very appreciative of the quick response and of your hard work. Again, thank you. Minical is a 5 star app!

Previous review: At some point during a recent update, Minical started parsing (perhaps this is not the correct word) US addresses differently than earlier versions. Previously US addresses were brought into the location field in an event, and they were ordered correctly. Now, however, the Zip code is inserted between the place/business name and the street address. Why the change that causes this? I find this both odd and annoying. Hence the loss of 2 stars. Old review: Minical is absolutely the best calendar app for iOS that I have used. Everything about this app is clearly laid out and works efficiently. The search function is fantastic. I have spent more time and money than one should in search of an easy to use and straightforward calendar app. Finally, I have found just such an app in Minical. In fairness to those reading this review, I did take the plunge and paid for the upgrade to the pro version. I have no regrets that I did. Recommended without hesitation.

title: very very solid but have some suggestions
content: thereâ€™s a lot to like about this app, itâ€™s probably been my favorite among them. i have sensory issues but needed a calendar app that would be customizable while able to be straightforward enough to use. i have been pleasantly surprised by the functionality of this app since i mainly got it for the different homescreen widgets. i rely heavily on them, and appleâ€™s own is not super great displaying all of the tasks added to the calendar. i have reminders but just prefer everything in one place. i love that you can get a daily digest of the entire day via notification (iâ€™ve never really been able to figure something out like that on the native app), as well as being able to add multiple custom colors. itâ€™s great for isolating different reminders or to-doâ€™s within a set calendar iâ€™m viewing or working in. it would be kinda cool to see a couple features added, though. i gave it 4 stars not expecting to enjoy it more than appleâ€™s - but not quite 5 because itâ€™s $12 for lifetime purchase and i think there could be a couple more features included that arenâ€™t there currently. thatâ€™s nitpicking, but maybe theyâ€™ll add it so i can change this to 5! itâ€™s close. price considered, it isnâ€™t even remotely close to the ridiculous subscription prices iâ€™ve seen so iâ€™m glad to have been given the choice for a permanent purchase. itâ€™s my default widget now, hopefully in the future just my default life app entirely. some wants: - let me view the calendar in app as a schedule, not just by month - let me import my reminders, allowing me to see my dated reminders on the schedule - an enriched section for to-dos or jotting simple notes would be cool thank you for making this app. overall iâ€™m enjoying it and hopefully it continues to get love and other people take to it. iâ€™m telling all my calendar peeps. i also hope you guys see this so that those features could be seen and maybe other want them too so they could be implemented :)))

title: Switched from android and all the calendars sucked
content: Until I tried minical. I am obviously sad after switching to iPhone because the widgets are not interactable like in android. I also miss having full screen calendar widgets like on android. This is the closest I can get to â€œmonthâ€� on android which displayed an entire screen widget of the current month. Obviously on android you could flip through the months and add events from the widget itself, but the best part was just being able to see the entire month with events at a glance. Not seeing which days had events and having to click in. Minical is limited because Apple hasnâ€™t accepted full screen size widgets but once they do, it will be amazing and I wonâ€™t have to click in to see days with multiple events that get cut off on the widget. Month on android also had way more customization and it was fun to match it with my wallpaper, but Minicalâ€™s  retro scheme is awesome so I got pro for that (and to get rid of ads). And I also got pro to get rid of ads because I found myself using it as my calendar, not just as a widget. I think Minical is onto something because of all the calendar apps, this widget app has become my daily driver. I click in and want to see a â€œweek viewâ€� on my full screen within the app, like some calendar apps have, and thereâ€™s no option for it and then I rememberâ€¦itâ€™s a widget app! I have a week view under my month view taking up an entire screen but again, with multiple events on one day, the week view even cuts off quite a bit. The only things that could fix this, a) apple accepts full screen size widgets, making it possible to see most or all events in a month widget or b) Minical converts to a full fledged calendar app with a week view option within. Either way, Iâ€™d like to see an optimized week view because the Google calendar shows thinly sliced days that require scrolling forever and donâ€™t give you a good overview of your day. The horizontal time block method with days of the week down the left side is better, if they could fit an entire week in a screen by condensing it, it would help SO MICH to see the open parts of the day in comparison to the others. Anyway, love the app, wish it were not widget focused because the interface is better than most calendars. If you need incentive to add the week view Iâ€™ll donate haha
